alfredsnippet.snippet:
"To the followers of Pythagoras the world and its phenomena were all illusion. Centuries later the mystic Plotinus taught the same doctrine, that the external world is a mere phantom, and the mystical schools of Christianity took it up in turn. In every age the mystically inclined have delighted in dreaming that everything is a dream, the mere visible reflection of an invisible reality ..."

(cont'd)
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - It is Our Judgment, Not Our Sight, that is Deceived - Part 1
